content: **pattern story** i wanted a simple 1x1 ribbed beanie in a dk weight yarn but could not find one i liked so i made the troy boy beanie it is a continuation of my troy boy pattern series because it is a very basic knit much like the basic troy boy **skills needed** this is an advanced beginner pattern cast on knit purl decreasing in pattern **yarn** west wool tandem 100g 233m / 254 yds sample uses norway for the long version and dijon for the short **gauge & needles** 31 sts x 35 row over 10cm / 4in in 1x1 rib the recommended needles are 3mm / us 2 5 with a 40cm / 16in circular cable or dpn s **recommended notions** one removable stitch marker tapestry needle double pointed needles or a longer cord for magic loop **finished measurements** both versions have a circumference of 47cm / 18 5in long total height 26cm / 10 25in short total height 21cm / 8 25in fits head circumference of 51-59 cm / 20-23 in **pattern notes** this is knitted in one piece in the round from brim to top
